entry.value: input table containing columns to be selected for hierarchical clustering

Metanode performs hierarchical clustering (cluster analysis) using the data in specified columns and plots resulting dendrogram.%%00010%%00010Cluster analysis is done on complete multidimensional (row = dimension) data matrix only, i.e. all rows containing at least one missing value are ignored.%%00010%%00010Cluster analysis has these two settings:%%00010- distance metric - how the distance between the two columns should be calculated, e.g. euclidian, cityblock see e.g. https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.spatial.distance.pdist.html for more details%%00010- cluster method - method for calculating the distances between clusters, e.g. complete, average; see e.g. https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy/reference/generated/scipy.cluster.hierarchy.linkage.html for more details%%00010%%00010%%00010Note: any data preprocessing (like transformation, normalization) should be done prior the metanode usage!%%00010%%00010=================%%00010%%00010Used programs and tools and their respective licenses at the time of the metanode creation. Version numbers and the licenses might differ based on your local installation. Please inspect your local installation and contact us if you can not locate your local version and or license terms.%%00010%%00010KNIME nodes (The KNIME nodes consists of the following GNU GPL 3.0 License.
